Legal_Issue: Failure to place qualified candidate on eligibility list
Procedural_Stage: Appeal Board decision under judicial review
Evidence_Assessment: Eligibility list expiration, pass mark revision
Legal_Rule: Highest-ranking qualified candidates must be selected for eligibility lists
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on issue
Procedural_Issue: Narrow interpretation of jurisdiction by Appeal Board
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural errors, perceived bias, failure to correct list
Outcome_on_Merits: Appeal Board erred in not reconsidering eligibility post-pass mark change
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to address irregularities affects fairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Pass mark of 65% struck down, Haney found qualified
Legal_Framework: Public Service Employment Act, administrative law principles
Applicant_Challenge: Bias, procedural unfairness, incorrect application of rules
Court_Result: Case remanded to new Appeal Board
Outcome: Judicial review granted, remanded for reconsideration
Legal_Provision: s. 17(1) of the Public Service Employment Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 17(1) of the Public Service Employment Act
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Request for inclusion on eligibility list
Governing_Rule: Selection based on merit and qualifications under s. 17(1)
